speech:
Thyme
thyme is a good companion for potatoes because it is particularly good at attracting hoverflies/syrphidae which help reduce aphid numbers through predation. it can also spread to create good ground cover.

Chamomile
It attracts a range of beneficial insects, including hoverflies and predatory wasps. chamomile also increases their oil production.

Basil
Basil is a herb that can do well when grown alongside potatoes. It repels certain common pests, including thrips, flies and hornworms.

Parsley
It attracts certain beneficial insects, and acts as a trap crop for insects that feed on potato plants

Calmint
Catmint has deterrent properties for certain pests e.g. potato beetles.
